choices.name: Get started with research for your Connecticut ancestors.

hidden.content:
• Learn successful research strategies for Connecticut ancestors.
  • Record Finder: Use the Record Finder to determine priorities for Connecticut research.

content.text:
1. Introduction: Learn about basic Connecticut research strategies.

    ☆ FS—Basic Connecticut Research Tips and Strategies
    ☆ AA—Connecticut Research

  2. Follow this research study for Connecticut ancestors, from 1880 to the present.

    ☆ FS—Step-by-Step Connecticut Research, 1880-Present

  3. Ancestry: Explore resources for Connecticut research on Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Connecticut Resources
    ☆ AC—Connecticut State Research Guide, 5 pgs.

  4. Record Finder: Use the Connecticut Record Finder to decide on records to search.

    ☆ FS—Connecticut Record Finder

  5. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.

  6. Resources: Watch this video to learn about additional resources for research.

    ☆ AA—A Guide to Connecticut Resources—60:37



  7. Learn about research in colonial Connecticut.

    ☆ AC—Colonial Connecticut

  8. Follow these case studies for Connecticut research.

    ☆ LDS—Solving a Connecticut Man's Unknown Parents
    ☆ LDS—Locating the Family of an Irish Woman in Connecticut

    9. Additional Records
    1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
    2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
    3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

Additional Records
  1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
  2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
  3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
Ethnic
  1. African American:
  2. Learn about African Americans in Connecticut in these FamilySearch Wiki articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for Connecticut
    ☆ FS—Wiki: Connecticut Minorities

  3. Explore the African American Gateway for Connecticut.
  4. Native American: Learn about American Indians in Connecticut in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of Connecticut

1. Explore Connecticut historical resources on FamilySearch.

    ☆ FS—Connecticut History

  2. Explore Connecticut history on Wikipedia.

    ☆ History
    ☆ History of Connecticut

hidden.content:

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for archives and libraries. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.

content.text:
1. Learn about Connecticut archives and libraries in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Connecticut Archives and Libraries
    ☆ Connecticut State Archives: Wonderful Local Sources for Genealogical Research
  2. Explore the State Archives and Libraries site for Connecticut.
  3. Explore the Connecticut State Archives collection.
  4. Explore the State Archives and Libraries site for Connecticut.
  5. Explore the ☆Books We Own site for Connecticut genealogy publications. Volunteers may be available for lookup services.
  6. Search for ☆free online books on Connecticut research on the FamilySearch site.

hidden.content:

choices.name: Use the QUIKLinks (lightning bolts) or Connecticut County links (bottom) to quickly search common record collections for Connecticut.

content.text:
Note : To search records on these sites, you must be registered on the site or be at a FamilySearch Center.

  1. In the QUIKLinks, click the link for FamilySearch, Ancestry, Findmypast, or MyHeritage to view the corresponding record collection.
  2. Scroll down near the bottom of this page to see available county records. Click the name of the county for FamilySearch, or A for Ancestry, or L for Linkpendium.

1. In FamilySearch, explore the Connecticut Online Genealogy Records page for a variety of record collections.
  2. In each program (FamilySearch, Ancestry, or Findmypast), explore additional record collections besides the ones listed in QUIKLinks.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

content.text:
1. Visit the Connecticut Genealogy Network page on Facebook.
  2. Visit the Connecticut Genealogy page on Facebook.
  3. Visit the Connecticut Genealogy - Just Ask! page on Facebook.
  4. Visit the U.S. Northeast Genealogy Research page on Facebook.
  5. See the Genealogy on Facebook list of Facebook groups dedicated to helping with research for Connecticut.

Regional/Local Groups

1. Join the RootsChat forum and post questions about Connecticut research.
  2. Explore the Connecticut research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.
  3. Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about Connecticut research.
  4. Explore Connecticut research questions in the ☆Genealogy Stack Exchange.

hidden.content: • * Proficient: Make a list of Facebook groups, mailing lists, and genealogy societies of interest, and then join or subscribe to them.
